content: eight crafters I don't know if you've seen the little mouselings from Reaper
they're really cool they have different character classes
and that kind of thing well I wanted to make some dioramas with these one of the
dioramas I made was called cat and mouse and this one has the assassin Mouse and
the thief Mouse trying to sneak around this cat so let's hit the table and I'll
show you how I did this cool craft project called cat and mouse
hey crafter so here's what inspired me to do this project I saw these wooden
plaques at Michaels and they were really cheap and I thought oh they should be
great little kind of diorama boxes because I had all these reaper
mouselings from Reaper bones too and I thought oh it'd be fun to do different
themes that I'm this one I decided to do I had a assassin and a thief and I
thought it'd be fun to do kind of a theme of cat and mouse and I thought
that'd be cool so in that end I went online and found this really crazy cat
picture right so I dropped it into into a word and then just printed it out full
color so here you can see I have the picture cut out and printed out then I
have I did a wall piece for the entire interior of the box cut a door out of
that and then dude did a frame for the door just and this is just a lot of
black craft foam then I painted it with my stone technique so I used some burnt
umber and gray sponging to get a nice stone technique sing with the door frame
and after I had that completed and dried I put the masonry blocks on there so
what it is I just used a pen drew out the blocks and then painted with a with
acrylic black because if you just use the pen to mark it it's it's kind of it
looks weird because it's kind of glossy but the black won't be so it's perfect
so I painted it with a thin brush in black and then after that I pasted the
cat picture into the frame so I just used
Elmer's glue-all for this and you can see that I've also painted the frame
kind of a golden brown there okay and I just use regular craft acrylic craft
paints on that then here's the completed wall with the doorway I actually added a
little bit of a shadow with acrylic black paint they're just very watered
down just around the edge of the door and then I glued that in with the
Elmer's glue-all and so you can see that cat looking through the door I love that
I think it's so so cool so I had a few more details to finish up so I got some
foam core and I used that for the floor so I marked I kind of strip that would
fit on the bottom then I painted up the mouseling so here we go I've got my
thief and assassin those guys will be the the main characters in this drama
and I want to have a few more details so I was gonna add a pillar here's the base
of the pillar I just used a few pieces of wood and here's the pillar itself I
just bent some cardboard scored it and bent it and then just painted it just
like the other masonry I also have some supports coming down there the end those
are that's just foam core also and I added some sand to the base to make it
look like rubble because I wanted to make it look like it's kind of a ruin
and I did add some cardboard pieces on the top of the foam on the bottom
because the glue wouldn't really stick very well to the bottom so I wanted to
add something solid the mouselings can be stuck too instead of just the foam
core so and I had one last detail I added a plaque to say what it is so
let's at the table and I'll show you this this really cool mouseling diorama
here it is all completed you see the scale compared to my hand so nice little
diorama here we have a hook on the back that I got I just lude that on the back
with some goop we got the game of cat and mouse I really like that little
plaque it's just I printed that out on a printer and just paint it with a little
bit of brown paint and I just think it's a really nice little diorama looks great
that cat is fantastic crazed cat and a great way to enhance
little mouselings now all I need to do is find a nice place on the wall
you
